headline: McDONALD'S RAISES QUARTERLY CASH DIVIDEND BY 5%
summary: McDonald's Board of Directors declared a quarterly cash dividend of $1.86 per share of common stock payable on December 15, 2025 to shareholders of record at the close of business on December 1, 2025. The 5% increase over the Company's previous quarterly dividend reflects continued confidence in the Accelerating the Arches growth strategy and our ability to drive long-term profitable growth for all stakeholders.

raw.headline: McDONALD'S RAISES QUARTERLY CASH DIVIDEND BY 5%

headline: AWS Outage: Why Amazon Stock Didn't Take A Hit From Cloud Crash
summary: Amazon started off the week racing to fix a massive cloud outage that drove errors for users of apps from McDonald's to Robinhood Markets.  Despite the AWS meltdown, Amazon stock is poised to end the week with a modest gain.  The gains Monday came even as the extent of its Amazon Web Services outage became clear early that morning and set off cascading problems across the broader internet throughout the day.

headline: Beyond Meat shares surge over 1,000pc in ‘meme stock’ frenzy
summary: Shares in fake meat business Beyond Meat have soared almost 1,300pc in under a week as so-called “meme stock” investors plough into the unloved US business.

raw.headline: Beyond Meat shares surge over 1,000pc in ‘meme stock’ frenzy
raw.summary: Shares in fake meat business Beyond Meat have soared almost 1,300pc in under a week as so-called “meme stock” investors plough into the unloved US business.

headline: Krispy Kreme Takes a Meme Stock Ride. Don’t Bite.
summary: Krispy Kreme  is the latest meme stock to see its share price suddenly surge.  Shares have slid more than 51%, thanks to slumping revenue and a much-anticipated deal with McDonald’s that failed to pan out.  While the company withdrew its outlook following the McDonald’s debacle this spring, analysts expect sales to tumble about 8% this year, according to FactSet.

headline: Forget GameStop: Meme Stock Traders Are Now Pumping Beyond Meat—Here's Why
summary: Roaring Kitty and meme stock traders pushed GameStop (GME) to unprecedented highs in 2021. Can history repeat with Beyond Meat (BYND)?

headline: The Middleby Corporation (MIDD): A Bull Case Theory
summary: We came across a bullish thesis on The Middleby Corporation on Iceman Capital’s Substack. In this article, we will summarize the bulls’ thesis on MIDD. The Middleby Corporation’s share was trading at $133.52 as of September 29th. MIDD’s trailing and forward P/E were 16.92 and 14.14 respectively according to Yahoo Finance.
